ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: In order to improve performance for HTTP API clients, 'httpcache' provides simple tools for caching and invalidating cache. It includes the HTTP verb functions GET, PUT, PATCH, POST, and DELETE, which are drop-in replacements for those in the 'httr' package. These functions are cache-aware and provide default settings for cache invalidation suitable for RESTful APIs; the package also enables custom cache-management strategies. Finally, 'httpcache' includes a basic logging framework to facilitate the measurement of HTTP request time and cache performance.

In order to improve performance for HTTP API clients, 'httpcache' provides simple tools for caching and invalidating cache. It includes the HTTP verb functions GET, PUT, PATCH, POST, and DELETE, which are drop-in replacements for those in the 'httr' package. These functions are cache-aware and provide default settings for cache invalidation suitable for RESTful APIs; the package also enables custom cache-management strategies. Finally, 'httpcache' includes a basic logging framework to facilitate the measurement of HTTP request time and cache performance.

name: r-httpcache
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = "1.2.0" %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-httpcache
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/httpcache_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/httpcache/httpcache_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 798c004f59826d1c2da16c58a212dc1facf225c29cc2d4a21e54053052a0da08

build:
  number: 4
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-digest
    - r-httr >=1.0.0
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-digest
    - r-httr >=1.0.0

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('httpcache')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('httpcache')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: http://enpiar.com/r/httpcache, https://github.com/nealrichardson/httpcache
  license: MIT
  summary: In order to improve performance for HTTP API clients, 'httpcache' provides simple tools for caching and invalidating cache. It includes the HTTP verb functions GET, PUT, PATCH, POST, and DELETE, which are drop-in replacements for those in the 'httr' package. These functions are cache-aware and provide default
    settings for cache invalidation suitable for RESTful APIs; the package also enables custom cache-management strategies. Finally, 'httpcache' includes a basic logging framework to facilitate the measurement of HTTP request time and cache performance.
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - {{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: httpcache
# Type: Package
# Title: Query Cache for HTTP Clients
# Description: In order to improve performance for HTTP API clients, 'httpcache' provides simple tools for caching and invalidating cache. It includes the HTTP verb functions GET, PUT, PATCH, POST, and DELETE, which are drop-in replacements for those in the 'httr' package. These functions are cache-aware and provide default settings for cache invalidation suitable for RESTful APIs; the package also enables custom cache-management strategies. Finally, 'httpcache' includes a basic logging framework to facilitate the measurement of HTTP request time and cache performance.

# Authors@R: c(person("Neal", "Richardson", role = c("aut", "cre"), email = "neal.p.richardson@gmail.com"))
# URL: http://enpiar.com/r/httpcache, https://github.com/nealrichardson/httpcache

# Depends: R (>= 3.0.0)
# Imports: digest, httr (>= 1.0.0), utils
# Suggests: httptest, knitr
# RoxygenNote: 6.0.1
# VignetteBuilder: knitr
# NeedsCompilation: no
